meanings.definition: A person who acts obsequiously towards someone important in order to gain advantage.
meanings.sent1: The sycophants surrounded the boss, always agreeing with everything he said.
meanings.sent2: The politician was surrounded by sycophants who praised his every decision.
meanings.sent3: The sycophants at the office party were like shadows, never leaving the CEO's side.
meanings.sent4: The sycophants were like puppets, dancing to the tune of their powerful master.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sycophants bowing before the king was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: A person who flatters someone in order to gain favor or advantage.
meanings.sent1: She knew the sycophants would compliment her outfit to win her favor.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was tired of the sycophants who only praised her for personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The sycophants' constant flattery made everyone roll their eyes in amusement.
meanings.sent4: The sycophants' words were like honey, sweet but lacking sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with sycophants whispering false praises to the wealthy businessman.
